title: 2016: The Election as an Intelligence Operation
text: For r/WikiLeaks, the 2016 election wasn't just a political race; it was a digital forensic investigation. Data shows engagement exploding in July with the DNC leaks, validating community theories of a rigged primary. The narrative shifted to 'internet detective' mode in September, with users uncovering the 'Stonetear' Reddit posts linking Clinton's IT staff to email deletions (BleachBit). By November, the mood turned into a techno-thriller, with wild speculation about Julian Assange's safety and a 'Dead Man's Switch' dominating the discourse after his internet was cut.
